title: Mahabharata | Part 37 | Duryodhana disgraced | His Grace Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: Om Adhyana Timran Dhasya Dhyanaanjana Salakaya Chaksharanmeetam Jena Tasmai Sriturave Namah
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking spiritual blessings.

segments.key_quote: In this way the Pandavas were going on accumulating pious credits. On the other hand Duryodhana was merely enjoying all the royal opulence and he was not engaged in conducting any fire sacrifice or yajnas.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the Pandavas' austere life in exile, focused on spiritual practices, with Duryodhana's opulent lifestyle and envy, setting the stage for Duryodhana's plan to show off his wealth.

segments.key_quote: Now when Duryodhana heard this proposal from Karna that it is good to go and show up to the Pandavas and rub salt on their wounds, it appealed very much to Duryodhana because we all have seen how Duryodhana is very envious by nature and he liked to insult the Pandavas although there was no fault on their side.
segments.summary: Duryodhana, motivated by envy and instigated by Karna, seeks permission from Dhritarashtra to visit Dwaitavana under the guise of inspecting cows, concealing his true intention to humiliate the Pandavas.

segments.key_quote: Duryodhana with his retinue, he reached Vaithavana and which is said to be modern day Dev Vand in Uttar Pradesh and having reached there, he inspected all the cows, took count of them, asked about the health, he looked up the health records of all the cows and having considered all these things, having finished all his duties.
segments.summary: Duryodhana travels to Dwaitavana with his army and advisors, completing the pretense of inspecting the cows, and then sends scouts to find a suitable location to set up camp near the Pandavas to flaunt his opulence.

segments.key_quote: Some Gandharvas had come there, to that forest...Hindradeva...did not like this activity from this act of Duryodhana's where he wanted to humiliate the Pandavas...Gandharvas and told them, see like this Duryodhana is going to Dwaitavana with an evil intention, you go and take care of him.
segments.summary: Gandharvas, sent by Indra due to Duryodhana's malicious intentions, arrive in Dwaitavana and prevent Duryodhana's forces from setting up camp, leading to an impending conflict.

segments.key_quote: Now, a fierce battle started with between the small army of Duryodhana along with Karna, Shakuni, Dushasana and others and on the other side, a small group of the Gandharvas...Finally, what happened? Shakuni ran away from the battlefield when he saw that his life was in danger.
segments.summary: A battle ensues between Duryodhana's army and the Gandharvas, resulting in the Kauravas' defeat, the cowardly retreat of Karna, Shakuni, and Dushasana, and Duryodhana's capture.

segments.key_quote: So they consulted amongst themselves and they thought it wise to approach the Pandavas and seek their help because they were close at hand...The moment Pandavas heard that Duryodhana had come there and he had been captured by the Gandharvas, they immediately understood what was the background of this whole incident.
segments.summary: Duryodhana's remaining soldiers seek help from the Pandavas, who, despite knowing Duryodhana's intentions, are bound by their Kshatriya dharma to offer protection.

segments.key_quote: Yudhishek maharaj immediately he stopped the bhimasena and told him no no no we should not talk like this right now these people have come and surrendered to us they have taken our shelter and asked shatria it is our duty to protect anyone who comes and takes shelter of us
segments.summary: Yudhishthira instructs Arjuna and Bhima to rescue Duryodhana, emphasizing the importance of family ties and the duty to protect those who seek shelter, despite internal conflicts.

segments.key_quote: So immediately the gandharvas also took their weapons arjuna and bhimasena on this side and again began a real mega fight between the two of them the celestial gandharvas on one side and on this side arjuna and dhima in the first case what had happened the gandharvas had very easily defeated duryodhana and pushed him back duryodhana karna dushasana all his hundred brothers all defeated and here there were only two brothers
segments.summary: Arjuna and Bhima engage the Gandharvas in battle, eventually leading to a truce and a discussion about Duryodhana's fate, with the Gandharvas agreeing to let Yudhishthira decide.

segments.key_quote: So then finally the gandharva said indra himself sent us here to prevent such a humiliation of you pandavas at the hands of duryodhana so now we have captured him we want to take him as a prisoner to swarga so yudhishthira maharaj said no no i understand what you have done that you have done as a favor by preventing duryodhana from doing from his evil deed but at the same time duryodhana is still part of our kaurava clan and if you capture him and take him like this it will be a great human humiliation for our dynasty not only that his people have come and taken shelter of us like shatryas it is our duty to provide shelter to them and to rescue duryodhana we cannot refuse our shelter to people who have come and surrendered to us so i request you to please release duryodhana
segments.summary: Yudhishthira, upholding dharma and compassion, convinces the Gandharvas to release Duryodhana, prioritizing family honor and the duty to protect those who seek shelter.

segments.key_quote: Duryodhana went back to his camp with a heavy heart he what he had set out to achieve he had achieved exactly the opposite he had set out to humiliate the pandavas on the other hand he got humiliated by the by the pandavas and the pandavas had to come to rescue him all his army his his brothers karna shakuni none of them could come to his health the pandavas had to come and help him and rescued him what greater humiliation can there be than this
segments.summary: Duryodhana returns to his camp humiliated and despondent, contemplating suicide, but is eventually persuaded to continue living, only to return to his old ways of plotting against the Pandavas, setting up the next episode.
